intro: Amsinckia rostrata, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils. The plant features a basal rosette of lobed, hairy leaves and produces showy yellow flowers with five petals. Its fruit is a slender, elongated capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds. Amsinckia rostrata is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures, making it a resilient member of its ecosystem.
